this patch sets the form field "referedby" to 'redo' if the user comes from the post's permalink, which triggers post.php to look up the new permalink and use that. (the 'redo' thing was code already in use for pages, so I just piggybacked onto it).

item.title: Ticket #1813 ("Publish" button shows up for posts that have already been published) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Looks like $post_status got discontinued along the way, so the "Publish" button is showing up all the time, which is annoying. Patch changes $post_status to $post->post_status.

Has been tested, and works as it should.

item.title: Ticket #1802 (Underscores not valid in CSS class/id names) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
underscores.txt was generated with this command: 

$ grep -iRoE '(id|class)="[a-z]*_[a-z]*"' * | grep -o '".*"' | replace '"' '' | sort | uniq > underscores.txt

item.title: Ticket #1811 (possible bug in kubrick default template breaks images with custom ...) created
item.dc:creator: jbwhong
item.description:
Hello everyone.

Please accept my apologies if this is not an actual bug. I was looking for someplace (the wiki, perhaps?) to discuss this before submission, but was unable to locate such a place.

THE SETUP:

Using default theme version 1.5

Custom permalink structure is:

/index.php/archives/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%postname%/

THE PROBLEM

Permalinks work, but if you visit a page, images break. For example, I posted three images to:

​http://jason.whong.org/index.php/archives/2005/11/01/creating-a-music-bed-in-imovie/

And the three images don't load. (If you visit the page, I am now using a modified Jillij 1 theme.

THE FIX:

The (almost) fix was found at the codex:

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/9261

By adding the following to header.php, I fixed the images:

<?php

$basehref = "​http://".$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'].($_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME']); ?>

<base href="<?php echo"$basehref"; ?>">

HOWEVER:

But as the author of Jillij, Jérôme, pointed out to me, this change causes another feature to break. If you click on the link directly above each comment, it now goes to index.php.

Example: under Wordpress Default without the base href mod, the link above comment 493 in my blog points to the correct spot. (​http://jason.whong.org/index.php/archives/2005/11/01/creating-a-music-bed-in-imovie/#comment-493) With the fix, the link now goes to (​http://jason.whong.org/index.php/#comment-493). So my fix is not really a fix at all.

I don't believe I had this problem with 1.2, but it has been a long time for me, so I don't really know. Again, please accept my apologies if I reported this one in error. Apologies also for not locating a list of severity ratings and their definition before selecting a severity. I picked "major" because it appears to break something that should work.

item.title: Ticket #1808 (mysql 5 incompatibility: WordPress database error: [Out of range value ...) created
item.dc:creator: hlke
item.description:
it appears that version 1.5.2 is incompatible with mysql version 5.0.15 when installed on a server runing IIS 6.0. This appears to be related to variable type mis-matches that are more strictly enforced by mysql 5 than 4.1.

For example, if I edit my user info and leave the ICQ field blank, I get an error that says: WordPress database error: [Out of range value adjusted for column 'user_icq' at row 1]

The query reveals that it is trying to update user_icq with , but user_icq is supposed to be an int. In the profile.php code there is a function to check to make sure the if there is a value for ICQ that it is all numbers, but nothing that converts into an int so it can be inserted into the database.

I had a number of similar errors but did not fully document them before rolling back to mysql 4.1.

An error also occurs in functions that run an update query that doesn't contain an update value for "variable x" but "variable x" is set to not allow null values with no default value set. An error that says something like "no default specified for variable x" occurs and the row is not updated.

It seems that it will require a lot of work to make WordPress compatible with MySQL 5, but in the meantime a message in the system requirements section that says they are incompatible would suffice. Sorry I don't have more specific documentation of the errors for this bug report.

item.title: Ticket #1807 (Password protected post can be escape by category_name) created
item.dc:creator: clsu
item.description:
Hi, I'm running WordPress 1.5.2 with PHP 4.3.10 and Apache 1.3.33 on my Debian GNU/Linux

And I found this problem in accidental.

1.Create an new password protected post and set categories to "protected"

2.Access it through follow URL: ​http://chinglong.no-ip.info/index.php?category_name=protected

In my case, the page can be access without enter password!
